title: How do I find out what font is used in a PDF on a Mac?
content:
Open the PDF file in the editor. Right-click on the document and select Select Tool. Select the text and right-click again to select Text Properties. Open the Formatting tab to view the font type and other details.

Fonts Monster
creator: wasaedit1232

title: Does the bionic font type really turn slower readers into fast readers instantly?
content:
There is no font type that can instantly turn slower readers into fast readers. Reading speed is influenced by various factors, including language proficiency, comprehension skills, and individual cognitive abilities.

Font Sonic

title: Youtube lowering resolution on unwatched tab
content:
I'm running the desktop version of FF 132.0 with no adblockers.

When watching a YT video at 1080p, if I leave the tab to look at other tabs, when I go back to the video playing it's dropped the resolution to 640*360. It is annoying because I don't know if YT or FF is adjusting the resolution.

If have two instances of FF open with YT running in one tab only (on a single tab with no other tabs open), the I browse using the second instance of FF. The video still lowers in resolution, when I'm not actively watching.

Is it FF, YT or perhaps my GPU trying to save bandwidth?

My PC specs are 5900x, 32GB DDR4, rx7700xt running Windows 11.

title: WidevineCdm Plugin Crash on Firefox
content:
I'm unable to stream content on Spotify and Netflix in Firefox due to a recurring "WidevineCdm plugin has crashed" error. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Steps I've already taken to troubleshoot:

  • Ensured "Play DRM-restricted content" is enabled in Firefox.
  • Tested with a completely clean Firefox profile.
  • Tried the portable version of Firefox (131.0.3) as well, but the same issue arose.
  • Verified that streaming works fine on Microsoft Edge and Google Chrome, so I don't think it's an issue with my PC or security software (I temporarily disabled it for testing purposes).
  • Made sure I'm not using any VPN or proxy.
  • Performed a clean reinstall of the latest Firefox version.

System information:

  • OS: Windows 11 (23H2)
  • Firefox version: 132.0
creator: orangehermit

title: Firefox e o CSP - Content-Security-Header
content:
Olá,

Há pouco tempo passei a usar as 'Security Headers' configuradas no .htaccess. Só houve um problema com a CSP - Content-Security-Policy, pois o Firefox desconfigura o site, que tem um Iframe. Os outros Browsers mais conhecidos navegam bem.

Já desabilitei todas as extensões e temas desses navegadores.

Estou usando a CSP dessa forma: Header set Content-Security-Policy "default-src 'self'; script-src 'self'; img-src 'self'; style-src 'self';base-uri 'self'; form-action 'self'"

Já tirei um por um até ficar assim: Header set Content-Security-Policy "default-src 'self'"

Mas o problema continua no Firefox. Alguma sugestão?

Apenas como informação:

Aparência do site normal, usando o Firefox (sem o CSP):

Aparência do site desconfigurado, usando o Firefox (com o CSP):

title: All Sync Data Was Removed Upon Password Reset
content:
I submitted this as a bug report but I will also submit this here to see if anyone has any information or a solution.

After resetting my password, none of my sync data from before the install is there. Only the sync data from my laptop, but even on my laptop it no longer lists my old computer, it is as if my PC from before the new OS has simply been deleted from the sync logs. In fact, my sync logs only go back to the moment I changed my password. I am not sure how to proceed as it appears that there aren't even any traces of my sync from before this point.

It would be nice if I could get the old tabs I had open on my desktop before I changed my OS, but it's not exactly a "world ending" situation.
